jparsec.graph.chartRendering

Enum Graphics.ANAGLYPH_COLOR_MODE

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<Graphics.ANAGLYPH_COLOR_MODE>
      • jparsec.graph.chartRendering.Graphics.ANAGLYPH_COLOR_MODE
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<Graphics.ANAGLYPH_COLOR_MODE>
    Enclosing interface:
    Graphics

    public static enum Graphics.ANAGLYPH_COLOR_MODE
extends java.lang.Enum<Graphics.ANAGLYPH_COLOR_MODE>
    The set of color modes for the anaglyph method. There are two simple anaglyph modes (green-red and red-cyan glasses) to obtain an adequate anaglyph effect without losing too much performance in sky rendering. In case you select one of these you should also select the SkyRenderElement.COLOR_MODE.WHITE_BACKGROUND_SIMPLE_GREEN_RED_OR_RED_CYAN_ANAGLYPH color mode. For other anaglyph methods the set of colors can be freely adjusted, and can be applied to sky, planetary, and satellite rendering.

    • Enum Constant Summary

      Enum Constants 
      Enum Constant and Description
      DUBOIS_AMBER_BLUE
      Dubois anaglyph mode, amber-blue anaglyph.
      DUBOIS_GREEN_MAGENTA
      Dubois anaglyph mode, green-magenta anaglyph.
      DUBOIS_RED_CYAN
      Dubois anaglyph mode, red-cyan anaglyph.
      GREEN_RED
      Simple green-red anaglyph: green for left eye, red for right.
      NO_ANAGLYPH
      ID value for no anaglyph mode.
      RED_CYAN
      Simple red-cyan anaglyph: red for left eye, cyan for right.
      TRUE_3D_MODE_LEFT_RIGHT
      Returns a true 3d image with left/view mode.
      TRUE_3D_MODE_LEFT_RIGHT_HALF_WIDTH
      Returns a true 3d image with left/view mode, and half width for each view.

      • isReal3D

        public boolean isReal3D()
        Returns true if the mode is set to a real 3d mode (Dubois or left/right view).
        Returns:
        True for any Dubois method and for the true left/right 3d mode, false otherwise.

      • is3D

        public boolean is3D()
        Returns true if the mode is a 3d one.
        Returns:
        True in case the mode is not set to NO_ANAGLYPH.

      • isDubois

        public boolean isDubois()
        Returns true if the mode is set to any of the Dubois methods.
        Returns:
        True for any Dubois method, false otherwise.

      • getReferenceZ

        public float getReferenceZ()
        Returns the reference z position, 100 by default. Levels visible in depth will be from 0 to 2*z. This means that the z position of the points/lines to draw should be within this interval.
        Returns:
        Reference z position.

      • getEyeSeparation

        public float getEyeSeparation()
        Returns the eye separation, (8 / reference z) for red-cyan and green-red simple anaglyph, and 0.5 by default for Dubois method. Dubois method is more powerful and allows a lot of range in distances. This means that since the points to draw are restricted to distances from 0 to 2*reference z, then the left/right images will be separated by +/- 8 (or +/- 50 pixels at most for Dubois method).
        Returns:
        Eye separation.

      • setReferenceZ

        public void setReferenceZ(float z)
        Sets the reference z position. Levels visible in depth will be from 0 to 2*z. This means that the z position of the points/lines to draw should be within this interval.
        Parameters:
        z - Reference distance.

      • setEyeSeparation

        public void setEyeSeparation(float d)
        Sets the eye separation, only for Dubois method. Should be between 0 and 5. Default value is 0.5.
        Parameters:
        d - Eye separation. In case input value is lower than 0 it will be set to zero, in case is greater than 5.0 it will be set to 5.

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Resets reference z and eye separation values to their default values.
